visualization_prompt: Generate a bell curve showing IQ score distribution using normal distribution parameter estimation with a hidden data series
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 78 univariate numerical observations of IQ scores. As real-world data sourced from openintro.org, it demonstrates a roughly normal distribution (μ ≈ 109, σ ≈ 15) despite minor outliers. The hidden raw data series ensures statistical validity while maintaining visual clarity. The bell curve visualization employs Tufte's data-ink ratio principles by eliminating redundant gridlines and legend. Cairo's perceptual principles are implemented through semi-transparent distribution fill (4A90E2 color with 0.3 opacity) to enable simultaneous perception of probability density and distribution shape. The chart uses axis label styling (#666 color) to maintain hierarchy while the calculated normal curve serves as a statistical anchor, demonstrating close alignment with the empirical data distribution.
